evidence: X-rays are attenuated as they pass through tissue
attenuation creates contrast in an image
signal is attenuated according to the exponential law
contrast is defined as the difference between the normal signal and the signal through the nodule
contrast depends only on μ, the attenuation coefficient
contrast agents or advanced imaging methods are often necessary

triples.evidence: Notice that the contrast depends only on μ, the attenuation coefficient, and z, the extra thickness of the nodule.
triples.o: μ, the attenuation coefficient, and z, the extra thickness of the nodule

triples.evidence: This simple example shows the mechanism of attenuation contrast: the difference in signal arises because one path is slightly longer or passes through tissue with different attenuation properties.

concepts.term: In real soft tissue, μ is much smaller, closer to 0.2 per centimeter

evidence: The difference in signal arises because one path is slightly longer or passes through tissue with different attenuation properties.
